0.html:
The mantra-py lib provides 4 main modules:

  • Wallet, to create addresses and send transactions.
  • Client, to query blockchain information.
  • TxBuilder, to interact with the blockchain.
  • Webhooks, to subscribe to on-chain events.

Examples

  • Webhooks API, using the Webhooks module, it provides an API to subscribe to events from outside your program.
0.text:
The mantra-py lib provides 4 main modules:

Wallet, to create addresses and send transactions.
Client, to query blockchain information.
TxBuilder, to interact with the blockchain.
Webhooks, to subscribe to on-chain events.

Examples

Webhooks API, using the Webhooks module, it provides an API to subscribe to events from outside your program.
0.title: Get started

1.html: This API allows clients to register, manage, and retrieve webhooks that listen for specific events on the Mantra blockchain. The API processes blockchain events in real-time and notifies registered webhooks based on customizable query conditions.
1.text: This API allows clients to register, manage, and retrieve webhooks that listen for specific events on the Mantra blockchain. The API processes blockchain events in real-time and notifies registered webhooks based on customizable query conditions.
1.title: Mantrapy Webhook API Documentation

2.title: Table of Contents

3.html:
Ensure you have FastAPI, asyncio, and the necessary database dependencies installed in your environment.

pip install fastapi uvicorn sqlalchemy
3.text:
Ensure you have FastAPI, asyncio, and the necessary database dependencies installed in your environment.
pip install fastapi uvicorn sqlalchemy
3.title: Installation

4.html:
Run the FastAPI application with:

uvicorn your_module_name:app --reload

Replace your_module_name with the name of the file where the FastAPI app is defined.
4.text:
Run the FastAPI application with:
uvicorn your_module_name:app --reload
Replace your_module_name with the name of the file where the FastAPI app is defined.
4.title: Usage

6.html:
Creates a new webhook that listens to specific blockchain events.

Request Body
  • url (str): The webhook endpoint URL.
  • query (str): Conditions to filter blockchain events. Example: "module=bank&value=/cosmos.bank.v1beta1.MsgSend "
Response
  • 200 Created: Webhook created successfully.
{
  "message": "Webhook created",
  "hook_id": "unique-hook-id"
}
  • 400 Bad Request: Invalid query or webhook URL.
6.title: POST /webhooks/

7.html:
Removes a registered webhook by ID.

Parameters
  • hook_id (str): The unique ID of the webhook to delete.
Response
  • 200 OK: Webhook deleted successfully.
{
  "message": "Webhook deleted",
  "hook_id": "unique-hook-id"
}
  • 404 Not Found: Webhook not found.
7.title: DELETE /webhooks/{hook_id}

8.html:
Retrieves a list of all registered webhooks.

Response
  • 200 OK: List of registered webhooks.
{
"hooks": [
        {
            "id": "unique-hook-id",
            "url": "webhook-url",
            "query": "query-string"
        },
        ...
    ]
}
8.title: GET /webhooks/

9.html:
Retrieves a specific webhook by ID.

Parameters
  • hook_id (str): The unique ID of the webhook to retrieve.
Response
  • 200 OK: Webhook details.
{
  "hook": {
    "id": "unique-hook-id",
    "url": "webhook-url",
    "query": "query-string"
  }
}
  • 404 Not Found: Webhook not found.
9.title: GET /webhooks/{hook_id}

10.html:
Webhook queries are customizable to match specific blockchain event conditions, with the following supported parameters:

  • module: Filters by blockchain module (e.g., module=staking).
  • type: Filters by event type (e.g., type=transfer).
  • attribute: Filters by event attribute (e.g., attribute=sender).
  • value: Filters by specific event value (e.g., value=mantra1...).
  • address: Filters by account address activity (e.g., address=mantra1...).
  • contract: Filters by smart contract address activity (e.g., contract=mantra1...).

It is possible to make a combination of these. Events will be filtered in the order especified in the query.

Example Query: "module=bank&value=/cosmos.bank.v1beta1.MsgSend"
10.text:
Webhook queries are customizable to match specific blockchain event conditions, with the following supported parameters:

module: Filters by blockchain module (e.g., module=staking).
type: Filters by event type (e.g., type=transfer).
attribute: Filters by event attribute (e.g., attribute=sender).
value: Filters by specific event value (e.g., value=mantra1...).
address: Filters by account address activity (e.g., address=mantra1...).
contract: Filters by smart contract address activity (e.g., contract=mantra1...).

It is possible to make a combination of these. Events will be filtered in the order especified in the query.
Example Query: "module=bank&value=/cosmos.bank.v1beta1.MsgSend"
10.title: Event Query Format

11.html:
All error responses include a detail field to explain the reason for the failure.

  • 400 Bad Request: Returned for invalid queries or data inputs.
  • 404 Not Found: Returned if a requested webhook ID does not exist.
  • 500 Internal Server Error: Server encountered an error processing the request.
11.text:
All error responses include a detail field to explain the reason for the failure.

400 Bad Request: Returned for invalid queries or data inputs.
404 Not Found: Returned if a requested webhook ID does not exist.
500 Internal Server Error: Server encountered an error processing the request.
11.title: Error Handling

14.html: The lib provides a wallet package to generate new accounts and sign transactions.
14.text: The lib provides a wallet package to generate new accounts and sign transactions.
14.title: Wallet

15.html:
from mantrapy.wallet.wallet import wallet_from_mnemonic
 
TEST_MNEMONIC = 'anger pencil awful note doctor like slide muffin hungry keen appear eight barrel stone quiz candy loud blush load three analyst buddy health member'  # noqa: E501
wallet = wallet_from_mnemonic(TEST_MNEMONIC)
15.text:

TEST_MNEMONIC = 'anger pencil awful note doctor like slide muffin hungry keen appear eight barrel stone quiz candy loud blush load three analyst buddy health member'  # noqa: E501
wallet = wallet_from_mnemonic(TEST_MNEMONIC)
15.title: New wallet from mnemonic

16.html:
from mantrapy.wallet.wallet import wallet_from_mnemonic, new_mnemonic
 
wallet = wallet_from_mnemonic(new_mnemonic())

privkey = wallet.privkey

18.title: Getters

19.html: The mantrapy library provides tools for integrating webhooks into your application. This module is split into three main components: ChainClient, EventProcessor, and a Webhook class, which work together to facilitate real-time processing and handling of blockchain events through webhooks.
19.text: The mantrapy library provides tools for integrating webhooks into your application. This module is split into three main components: ChainClient, EventProcessor, and a Webhook class, which work together to facilitate real-time processing and handling of blockchain events through webhooks.
19.title: Mantrapy Webhooks Documentation

21.html: ChainClient manages WebSocket connections and subscriptions to blockchain event streams. This client is used to connect to CometBFT (prev. Tendermint) RPC.
21.text: ChainClient manages WebSocket connections and subscriptions to blockchain event streams. This client is used to connect to CometBFT (prev. Tendermint) RPC.
21.title: ChainClient

22.html:
• Parameters:
    • websocket_url (str): The WebSocket URL for the blockchain server.
22.text:
Parameters:

websocket_url (str): The WebSocket URL for the blockchain server.
22.title: Class: ChainClient

23.html:
• connect(): Establishes a connection to the WebSocket server.

    • Returns: None
    • Raises: InvalidURI, InvalidHandshake

  • subscribe(query, max_retries=3): Subscribes to a specified query and yields incoming messages.

    • Parameters:
      • query (str): The query string to subscribe to. For example, to get all events when there's a transaction, use "tm.event='Tx'". For more information about events subscription on CometBFT and Cosmos-SDK chains, refer to their docs.
      • max_retries (int): Maximum number of reconnection attempts.
    • Returns: Async generator yielding WebSocket messages.
    • Raises: ConnectionClosedError, InvalidStatusCode, TimeoutError
23.text:
connect(): Establishes a connection to the WebSocket server.

Returns: None
Raises: InvalidURI, InvalidHandshake



subscribe(query, max_retries=3): Subscribes to a specified query and yields incoming messages.

Parameters:

query (str): The query string to subscribe to. For example, to get all events when there's a transaction, use "tm.event='Tx'". For more information about events subscription on CometBFT and Cosmos-SDK chains, refer to their docs.
max_retries (int): Maximum number of reconnection attempts.


Returns: Async generator yielding WebSocket messages.
Raises: ConnectionClosedError, InvalidStatusCode, TimeoutError
23.title: Methods

24.html:
from mantrapy.webhooks.chain_client import ChainClient
import asyncio
 
async def main():
    client = ChainClient("wss://example.com/socket")
    await client.connect()
    async for message in client.subscribe("tm.event='Tx'"):
        print("Received event:", message)
 
asyncio.run(main())
24.text:
from mantrapy.webhooks.chain_client import ChainClient
import asyncio
 
async def main():
    client = ChainClient("wss://example.com/socket")
    await client.connect()
    async for message in client.subscribe("tm.event='Tx'"):
        print("Received event:", message)
 
asyncio.run(main())
24.title: Example

25.html: EventProcessor processes and sends events via a POST HTTP request to a specified webhook endpoint. It allows for retries and exponential backoff in case of network issues.
25.text: EventProcessor processes and sends events via a POST HTTP request to a specified webhook endpoint. It allows for retries and exponential backoff in case of network issues.
25.title: EventProcessor

26.html:
• Parameters:
    • webhook_url (str): The URL of the webhook.
    • process_event_fn (callable): A function to process raw events (filtering/formatting).
    • post_retries (int): Number of retry attempts for failed webhook posts.
26.text:
Parameters:

webhook_url (str): The URL of the webhook.
process_event_fn (callable): A function to process raw events (filtering/formatting).
post_retries (int): Number of retry attempts for failed webhook posts.
26.title: Class: EventProcessor

27.html:
• set_query(query): Sets a query to include in notifications.
    • Parameters:
      • query (str): The event query string.
  • set_hook_id(hook_id): Sets a unique hook identifier.
    • Parameters:
      • hook_id (str): Identifier for the hook.
  • process_events(events): Processes events and sends the result via a POST HTTP request to the webhook URL.
    • Parameters:
      • events (list): List of events to process.
    • Raises: requests.exceptions.RequestException
27.text:
set_query(query): Sets a query to include in notifications.

Parameters:

query (str): The event query string.




set_hook_id(hook_id): Sets a unique hook identifier.

Parameters:

hook_id (str): Identifier for the hook.




process_events(events): Processes events and sends the result via a POST HTTP request to the webhook URL.


Parameters:

events (list): List of events to process.


Raises: requests.exceptions.RequestException
27.title: Methods

28.html:
from mantrapy.webhooks.event_processor import EventProcessor
 
def process_event_fn(events):
    # Custom processing logic for events
    return [{"type": event["type"], "data": event["attributes"]} for event in events]
 
processor = EventProcessor("https://webhook.example.com", process_event_fn)
processor.set_hook_id("hook_123")
 
# Process a batch of events
# Usually this comes from the subscription of a ChainClient
events = [{'type': 'message', 'attributes': [{'key': 'action', 'value': '/cosmos.bank.v1beta1.MsgSend', 'index': True}, {'key': 'sender', 'value': 'mantra1nagtgts4y4s3d08ykqe0vsd68l53gnlujms9zj', 'index': True}, {'key': 'module', 'value': 'bank', 'index': True}, {'key': 'msg_index', 'value': '0', 'index': True}]}]
processor.process_events(events)
28.text:
from mantrapy.webhooks.event_processor import EventProcessor
 
def process_event_fn(events):
    # Custom processing logic for events
    return [{"type": event["type"], "data": event["attributes"]} for event in events]
 
processor = EventProcessor("https://webhook.example.com", process_event_fn)
processor.set_hook_id("hook_123")
 
# Process a batch of events
# Usually this comes from the subscription of a ChainClient
events = [{'type': 'message', 'attributes': [{'key': 'action', 'value': '/cosmos.bank.v1beta1.MsgSend', 'index': True}, {'key': 'sender', 'value': 'mantra1nagtgts4y4s3d08ykqe0vsd68l53gnlujms9zj', 'index': True}, {'key': 'module', 'value': 'bank', 'index': True}, {'key': 'msg_index', 'value': '0', 'index': True}]}]
processor.process_events(events)
28.title: Example

29.html: The Webhook class brings together ChainClient and EventProcessor to handle WebSocket subscriptions and send events to a specified webhook URL.
29.text: The Webhook class brings together ChainClient and EventProcessor to handle WebSocket subscriptions and send events to a specified webhook URL.
29.title: Webhook

30.html:
• Parameters:
    • websocket_url (str): WebSocket URL for blockchain connections.
    • webhook_url (str): URL for sending processed events.
    • process_fn (callable): A function for processing WebSocket events.
    • event_query (str): Query for the events to subscribe to on the CometBFT (prev. Tendermint) RPC. Defaults to "tm.event='Tx'". For more information, refer to their docs.
  • Methods
    • listen(): Listens for incoming events and processes them before forwarding to the webhook URL.
      • Returns: None
      • Raises: JSONDecodeError, KeyError
30.text:
Parameters:

websocket_url (str): WebSocket URL for blockchain connections.
webhook_url (str): URL for sending processed events.
process_fn (callable): A function for processing WebSocket events.
event_query (str): Query for the events to subscribe to on the CometBFT (prev. Tendermint) RPC. Defaults to "tm.event='Tx'". For more information, refer to their docs.



Methods

listen(): Listens for incoming events and processes them before forwarding to the webhook URL.

Returns: None
Raises: JSONDecodeError, KeyError
30.title: Class: Webhook

31.html:
from mantrapy.webhooks.webhook import Webhook
 
# Define a custom event processing function
def process_event(events):
    return [{"event_type": event["type"], "content": event["attributes"]} for event in events]
 
webhook = Webhook("wss://blockchain.example.com/socket", "https://webhook.example.com", process_event)
 
# Start listening for events
import asyncio
asyncio.run(webhook.listen())
31.text:
from mantrapy.webhooks.webhook import Webhook
 
# Define a custom event processing function
def process_event(events):
    return [{"event_type": event["type"], "content": event["attributes"]} for event in events]
 
webhook = Webhook("wss://blockchain.example.com/socket", "https://webhook.example.com", process_event)
 
# Start listening for events
import asyncio
asyncio.run(webhook.listen())
31.title: Example

32.html:
A specialized webhook for handling smart contract events, SmartContractWebhook uses the Webhook base class and custom event-processing logic.

from mantrapy.webhooks.hooks.webhook import Webhook
from mantrapy.webhooks.modules.smart_contract import get_smart_contracts_events
 
class SmartContractWebhook(Webhook):
    def __init__(self, websocket_url, webhook_url):
        super().__init__(websocket_url, webhook_url, get_smart_contracts_events)
 
# Usage
smart_contract_webhook = SmartContractWebhook("wss://smartchain.example.com/socket", "https://webhook.example.com")
asyncio.run(smart_contract_webhook.listen())
32.text:
A specialized webhook for handling smart contract events, SmartContractWebhook uses the Webhook base class and custom event-processing logic.
from mantrapy.webhooks.hooks.webhook import Webhook
from mantrapy.webhooks.modules.smart_contract import get_smart_contracts_events
 
class SmartContractWebhook(Webhook):
    def __init__(self, websocket_url, webhook_url):
        super().__init__(websocket_url, webhook_url, get_smart_contracts_events)
 
# Usage
smart_contract_webhook = SmartContractWebhook("wss://smartchain.example.com/socket", "https://webhook.example.com")
asyncio.run(smart_contract_webhook.listen())
32.title: Example Usage: SmartContractWebhook
